datasets.name: ac2810e1
queryLines: SELECT BP.check_id, check as Check, BP.severity as Severity, score as Status, chk_date as RunDate, concat( '', BP.recommendation, '' ) as Recommendation, CASE WHEN BP.severity = 'High' THEN 3 WHEN BP.severity = 'Medium' THEN 2 ELSE 1 END as ord, workspaceid, concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") as name FROM ( SELECT id, score, chk_date, workspaceid FROM `sat`.security_analysis.security_checks where run_id = coalesce ( ( select max(run_id) from `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc, `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw where concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid and wrc.workspace_id = aw.workspace_id and completed = true and chk_date = :date_param ), ( select max(run_id) from `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc, `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw where concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid and wrc.workspace_id = aw.workspace_id and completed = true ) ) ) SC, `sat`.security_analysis.security_best_practices BP, `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw WHERE SC.id = BP.id and BP.category = :category and concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid and aw.workspace_id = SC.workspaceid and aw.analysis_enabled = true ORDER BY Status DESC, ord DESC

datasets.name: 367ba156
queryLines:
SELECT
  name,
  value.value
FROM
  `sat`.security_analysis.account_info ai,
  `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
where
  category = 'Account Stats'
  and run_id = coalesce (
    (
      select
        max(run_id)
      from
        `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc,
        `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
      where
        concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid
        and completed = true
        and chk_date = :date_param
        and aw.analysis_enabled = true
        and aw.workspace_id = wrc.workspace_id
    ),
    (
      select
        max(run_id)
      from
        `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc,
        `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
      where
        concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid
        and completed = true
    )
  )
  and concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid
  and aw.workspace_id = ai.workspaceid
ORDER BY
  name

datasets.name: 5e73087c
queryLines:
Select
  concat(
    results.category,
    ' (Out of ',
    category_count,
    ')'
  ) as category,
  severity,
  severity_count,
  ord
FROM
  (
    SELECT
      sbp.category,
      sbp.severity,
      count(sbp.severity) severity_count,
      CASE
        WHEN sbp.severity = 'High' THEN 3
        WHEN sbp.severity = 'Medium' THEN 2
        ELSE 1
      END as ord
    FROM
      `sat`.security_analysis.security_checks sc,
      `sat`.security_analysis.security_best_practices sbp,
      `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
    where
      score = 1
      and sc.id = sbp.id
      and run_id = coalesce (
        (
          select
            max(run_id)
          from
            `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc,
            `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
          where
            concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid
            and aw.workspace_id = wrc.workspace_id
            and completed = true
            and chk_date = :date_param
            and aw.analysis_enabled = true
        ),
        (
          select
            max(run_id)
          from
            `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc,
            `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
          where
            concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid
            and aw.workspace_id = wrc.workspace_id
            and completed = true
        )
      )
      and category not IN ('Workspace Settings', 'Workspace Stats')
      and concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid
      and sc.workspaceid = aw.workspace_id
    group by
      sbp.category,
      sbp.severity
  ) as results,
  (
    SELECT
      category,
      count(*) as category_count
    FROM
      `sat`.security_analysis.security_best_practices
    WHERE
      category not IN ('Workspace Settings', 'Workspace Stats')
    group by
      category
  ) as master
where
  results.category = master.category

parameters.displayName: Analysis date (Shows results for the most recent analysis when no analysis is found for this date)

datasets.name: 2eb723f9
queryLines:
SELECT
  count(*) as counter
FROM
  `sat`.security_analysis.security_checks sc,
  `sat`.security_analysis.security_best_practices sbp,
  `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
where
  sc.id = sbp.id
  and sbp.severity = :severity
  and sc.score = 1
  and sbp.category = :category
  and concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid
  and sc.workspaceid = aw.workspace_id
  and run_id = coalesce (
    (
      select
        max(run_id)
      from
        `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc,
        `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
      where
        concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid
        and completed = true
        and chk_date = :date_param
        and aw.workspace_id = wrc.workspace_id
    ),
    (
      select
        max(run_id)
      from
        `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc,
        `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
      where
        concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid
        and completed = true
        and aw.workspace_id = wrc.workspace_id
    )

datasets.name: 7088f4c8
queryLines:
select
  sbp.check_id,
  sbp.check,
  sbp.recommendation,
  sc.additional_details,
  sbp.logic,
  if(
    sbp.evaluation_value == -1,
    "N/A",
    concat(sbp.evaluation_value, " ")
  ) as evaluation_value,
  regexp_replace(sbp.api, "<workspace_url>", aw.deployment_url) as api,
  sc.check_time
from
  `sat`.security_analysis.security_checks sc,
  `sat`.security_analysis.security_best_practices sbp,
  `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
where
  sc.id = sbp.id
  and sc.run_id = coalesce (
    (
      select
        max(run_id)
      from
        `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc,
        `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
      where
        concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid
        and wrc.workspace_id = aw.workspace_id
        and completed = true
        and chk_date = :date_param
    ),
    (
      select
        max(run_id)
      from
        `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc,
        `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
      where
        concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid
        and wrc.workspace_id = aw.workspace_id
        and completed = true
    )
  )
  and concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid
  and aw.workspace_id = sc.workspaceid

datasets.name: de3b92f6
queryLines: SELECT sc1.score as current_score, sc2.score as previous_score, BP.check_id, check as Check, BP.severity as Severity, sc1.score as Run1Status, sc2.score as Run2Status, sc1.check_time as Run1Date, sc2.check_time as Run2Date, concat( '', BP.recommendation, '' ) as Recommendation, CASE WHEN BP.severity = 'High' THEN 3 WHEN BP.severity = 'Medium' THEN 2 ELSE 1 END as ord, sc1.workspaceid FROM `sat`.security_analysis.security_checks sc1, `sat`.security_analysis.security_checks sc2, `sat`.security_analysis.security_best_practices BP, `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw where concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid and sc1.workspaceid = aw.workspace_id and sc2.workspaceid = sc1.workspaceid and sc1.id = sc2.id and sc1.id = BP.id and sc1.run_id = coalesce ( ( select max(run_id) from `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc, `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw where concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid and wrc.workspace_id = aw.workspace_id and completed = true and chk_date = :current_run_date ), ( select max(run_id) from `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc, `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw where concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid and wrc.workspace_id = aw.workspace_id and completed = true ) ) and sc2.run_id = ( select max(run_id) from `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc, `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw where concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid and wrc.workspace_id = aw.workspace_id and completed = true and run_id = ( select max(run_id) from `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc, `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw where concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid and wrc.workspace_id = aw.workspace_id and completed = true and chk_date = :previous_run_date ) )

datasets.name: f1a73f2e
queryLines:
WITH workspace_info AS (
  SELECT
    workspace_id
  FROM
    `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces
  WHERE
    concat(workspace_name, " (", workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid
  LIMIT 1
),
latest_run AS (
  SELECT
    run_id
  FROM
    `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc
  JOIN workspace_info wi
    ON wrc.workspace_id = wi.workspace_id
  WHERE
    wrc.completed = true
    AND wrc.chk_date <= :date_param
  ORDER BY
    wrc.chk_date DESC,
    wrc.run_id DESC
  LIMIT 1
)
SELECT
  date_format(
    from_utc_timestamp(max(sc.check_time), 'America/New_York'),
    'yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm a'
  ) AS date
FROM
  `sat`.security_analysis.security_checks sc
JOIN workspace_info wi
  ON sc.workspaceid = wi.workspace_id
JOIN latest_run lr
  ON sc.run_id = lr.run_id;

datasets.name: 9264c052
queryLines:
WITH chosen_date AS (
    -- Determine the relevant date to pull runs from
    SELECT 
        COALESCE(
            (SELECT MAX(chk_date)
             FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete
             WHERE completed = true AND chk_date = :date_param),
            (SELECT MAX(chk_date)
             FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete
             WHERE completed = true AND chk_date < :date_param)
        ) AS chk_date
)
SELECT
    aw.workspace_id AS value,
    CONCAT(aw.workspace_name, ' (', aw.workspace_id, ')') AS name
FROM
    `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw,
    chosen_date cd
WHERE
    aw.analysis_enabled = true
    AND EXISTS (
        SELECT 1
        FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc
        WHERE wrc.workspace_id = aw.workspace_id
          AND wrc.completed = true
          AND wrc.chk_date = cd.chk_date
    )
ORDER BY
    aw.workspace_id ASC;

datasets.name: a4f85627
queryLines:
SELECT wrc.chk_date, wrc.workspace_id, concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") as name
FROM 
    `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc,
    `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
WHERE
concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid
and wrc.workspace_id = aw.workspace_id

datasets.name: 5d41c7dd
queryLines:
WITH chosen_date AS (
    -- Determine the effective run date: today if scans exist, else the last available date
    SELECT COALESCE(
        (SELECT MAX(chk_date)
         FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete
         WHERE completed = true AND chk_date = :date_param),
        (SELECT MAX(chk_date)
         FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete
         WHERE completed = true AND chk_date < :date_param)
    ) AS chk_date
),
LatestRuns AS (
    -- Get the latest run per workspace but only on the chosen date
    SELECT 
        wrc.workspace_id,
        MAX(wrc.run_id) AS latest_run_id
    FROM 
        `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc,
        chosen_date cd
    WHERE 
        wrc.completed = TRUE
        AND wrc.chk_date = cd.chk_date
    GROUP BY 
        wrc.workspace_id
)
SELECT 
    CONCAT(aw.workspace_name, ' (', aw.workspace_id, ')') AS Workspace_name,
    COUNT(CASE WHEN sbp.severity = 'High'   THEN 1 END) AS High,
    COUNT(CASE WHEN sbp.severity = 'Medium' THEN 1 END) AS Medium,
    COUNT(CASE WHEN sbp.severity = 'Low'    THEN 1 END) AS Low
FROM `sat`.security_analysis.security_checks sc
JOIN `sat`.security_analysis.security_best_practices sbp 
    ON sc.id = sbp.id
JOIN `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw 
    ON sc.workspaceid = aw.workspace_id
JOIN LatestRuns lr 
    ON sc.workspaceid = lr.workspace_id 
    AND sc.run_id = lr.latest_run_id
WHERE sc.score = 1
GROUP BY Workspace_name, aw.workspace_id
ORDER BY High DESC;

datasets.name: e6b69091
queryLines:
WITH severities AS (
  SELECT 'High' AS severity, 3 AS ord
  UNION ALL
  SELECT 'Medium', 2
  UNION ALL
  SELECT 'Low', 1
),
chosen_date AS (
  SELECT MAX(chk_date) AS chk_date
  FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete
  WHERE completed = true
    AND chk_date <= :date_param
),
latest_runs AS (
  SELECT workspace_id, run_id
  FROM (
    SELECT
      wrc.workspace_id,
      wrc.run_id,
      ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
        PARTITION BY wrc.workspace_id
        ORDER BY wrc.chk_date DESC, wrc.run_id DESC
      ) AS rn
    FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc
    WHERE wrc.completed = true
      AND wrc.chk_date = (SELECT chk_date FROM chosen_date)
  ) t
  WHERE rn = 1
),
master AS (
  SELECT
    category,
    COUNT(*) AS category_count
  FROM `sat`.security_analysis.security_best_practices
  WHERE category NOT IN ('Workspace Settings', 'Workspace Stats')
  GROUP BY category
),
workspace_count AS (
  SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT lr.workspace_id) AS ws_count
  FROM latest_runs lr
),
results AS (
  SELECT
    sbp.category,
    sbp.severity,
    COUNT(*) AS severity_count
  FROM `sat`.security_analysis.security_checks sc
  JOIN `sat`.security_analysis.security_best_practices sbp
    ON sc.id = sbp.id
  JOIN latest_runs lr
    ON sc.run_id = lr.run_id
   AND sc.workspaceid = lr.workspace_id
  WHERE sc.score = 1
    AND sbp.category NOT IN ('Workspace Settings', 'Workspace Stats')
  GROUP BY sbp.category, sbp.severity
),
category_totals AS (
  SELECT
    r.category,
    SUM(r.severity_count) AS total_deviations
  FROM results r
  GROUP BY r.category
)
SELECT
  m.category AS category,
  m.category_count AS total_checks_per_workspace,
  s.severity,
  COALESCE(r.severity_count, 0) AS severity_count,
  s.ord,
  COALESCE(ct.total_deviations, 0) AS total_deviations,
  CONCAT(
    (m.category_count * wc.ws_count - COALESCE(ct.total_deviations, 0)),
    '/', 
    (m.category_count * wc.ws_count),
    ' passed'
  ) AS passed_checks,
  try_divide(
    (m.category_count * wc.ws_count - COALESCE(ct.total_deviations, 0))::decimal,
    NULLIF(m.category_count * wc.ws_count, 0)
  ) AS category_pct
FROM master m
CROSS JOIN severities s
CROSS JOIN workspace_count wc
LEFT JOIN results r
  ON m.category = r.category AND s.severity = r.severity
LEFT JOIN category_totals ct
  ON m.category = ct.category
ORDER BY m.category, s.ord DESC;

datasets.name: 966f5f55
queryLines:
WITH job_info AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT
    job_id,
    name AS job_name
  FROM system.lakeflow.jobs
  WHERE trim(regexp_replace(name, '\\s+', ' ')) IN ('SAT Driver Notebook', 'SAT Secrets Scanner')
),
job_runs AS (
  SELECT
    t.run_id,
    t.job_id,
    t.period_start_time,
    t.period_end_time,
    j.job_name
  FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline t
  JOIN job_info j
    ON t.job_id = j.job_id
  WHERE t.result_state = 'SUCCEEDED'
),
latest_per_job AS (
  SELECT
    jr.*,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
      PARTITION BY jr.job_name
      ORDER BY jr.period_start_time DESC
    ) AS rn
  FROM job_runs jr
  WHERE date(from_utc_timestamp(jr.period_start_time, 'America/New_York')) <= :date_param
)
SELECT
  lr.job_name,
  lr.job_id,
  date_format(from_utc_timestamp(lr.period_start_time, 'America/New_York'), 'yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm a') AS period_start_time_local,
  date_format(from_utc_timestamp(lr.period_end_time, 'America/New_York'), 'yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm a') AS period_end_time_local,
  ROUND(TIMESTAMPDIFF(SECOND, lr.period_start_time, lr.period_end_time) / 60, 2) AS duration_minutes
FROM latest_per_job lr
WHERE lr.rn = 1
ORDER BY lr.period_start_time DESC;  -- latest run first

datasets.name: 6ef3dafc
queryLines:
WITH chosen_date AS (
    SELECT MAX(chk_date) AS chk_date
    FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete
    WHERE completed = TRUE
      AND chk_date <= :date_param
),
latest_runs AS (
    SELECT workspace_id, run_id
    FROM (
        SELECT
            wrc.workspace_id,
            wrc.run_id,
            ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
                PARTITION BY wrc.workspace_id
                ORDER BY wrc.chk_date DESC, wrc.run_id DESC
            ) AS rn
        FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc
        WHERE wrc.completed = TRUE
          AND wrc.chk_date = (SELECT chk_date FROM chosen_date)
    ) t
    WHERE rn = 1
)
SELECT
    concat(aw.workspace_name, ' (', aw.workspace_id, ')') AS workspace,
    COUNT(*) AS total_deviations
FROM `sat`.security_analysis.security_checks sc
JOIN `sat`.security_analysis.security_best_practices sbp
  ON sc.id = sbp.id
JOIN `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
  ON sc.workspaceid = aw.workspace_id
JOIN latest_runs lr
  ON sc.run_id = lr.run_id
 AND sc.workspaceid = lr.workspace_id
WHERE sbp.category = :category
  AND sc.score = 1
GROUP BY aw.workspace_name, aw.workspace_id
ORDER BY total_deviations DESC;

datasets.name: 002272b6
queryLines:
SELECT
  date_format(
    from_utc_timestamp(MAX(sc.check_time), 'America/New_York'),
    'yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm a'
  ) AS last_run_date
FROM
  `sat`.security_analysis.security_checks sc
JOIN `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc
  ON sc.run_id = wrc.run_id
  AND sc.workspaceid = wrc.workspace_id
WHERE
  wrc.completed = true
  AND wrc.chk_date <= :date_param;

datasets.name: 11d2fe5c
queryLines:
WITH param_ws AS (
  SELECT
    regexp_extract(:workspaceid, '\\((\\d+)\\)', 1) AS ws_id
),
latest_run AS (
  SELECT coalesce(
      (
        SELECT max(run_id)
        FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc
        JOIN `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw2
          ON aw2.workspace_id = wrc.workspace_id
        JOIN param_ws p
          ON aw2.workspace_id = p.ws_id
        WHERE completed = true
          AND chk_date = :date_param
          AND aw2.analysis_enabled = true
      ),
      (
        SELECT max(run_id)
        FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc
        JOIN param_ws p
          ON wrc.workspace_id = p.ws_id
        WHERE completed = true
      )
  ) AS run_id
)
SELECT
  aw.workspace_name,  -- ✅ real friendly name
  MAX(CASE WHEN ai.name = 'AS-5' THEN ai.value.value END) AS workspace_id,
  MAX(CASE WHEN ai.name = 'AS-2' THEN ai.value.value END) AS region,
  MAX(CASE WHEN ai.name = 'AS-4' THEN ai.value.value END) AS sku,
  MAX(CASE WHEN ai.name = 'AS-6' THEN ai.value.value END) AS status
FROM
  `sat`.security_analysis.account_info ai
JOIN `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
  ON aw.workspace_id = ai.workspaceid
JOIN param_ws p
  ON aw.workspace_id = p.ws_id
JOIN latest_run lr
  ON ai.run_id = lr.run_id
WHERE
  ai.category = 'Account Stats'
GROUP BY
  aw.workspace_name;

datasets.name: 20bd3313
queryLines:
WITH param_ws AS (
  -- Extract numeric workspace_id from the dropdown string
  SELECT regexp_extract(:workspaceid, '\\((\\d+)\\)', 1) AS ws_id
)
SELECT
    wl.workspace_name,
    wl.workspace_id,
    DATE(wl.create_time) AS workspace_created_at
FROM system.access.workspaces_latest wl
JOIN `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
  ON wl.workspace_id = aw.workspace_id
JOIN param_ws p
  ON aw.workspace_id = p.ws_id
WHERE aw.analysis_enabled = true;

datasets.name: f9761e50
queryLines:
WITH chosen_date AS (
    -- Determine the relevant date to pull runs from
    SELECT 
        COALESCE(
            (SELECT MAX(chk_date)
             FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete
             WHERE completed = true AND chk_date = :date_param),
            (SELECT MAX(chk_date)
             FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete
             WHERE completed = true AND chk_date < :date_param)
        ) AS chk_date
)
SELECT
    aw.workspace_id AS value,
    CONCAT(aw.workspace_name, ' (', aw.workspace_id, ')') AS name
FROM
    `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw,
    chosen_date cd
WHERE
    aw.analysis_enabled = true
    AND EXISTS (
        SELECT 1
        FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc
        WHERE wrc.workspace_id = aw.workspace_id
          AND wrc.completed = true
          AND wrc.chk_date = cd.chk_date
    )
ORDER BY
    aw.workspace_id ASC;

datasets.name: 2decf540
datasets.displayName: Workspace Scan Summary by Latest Completion Date
queryLines:
WITH chosen_date AS (
    SELECT MAX(chk_date) AS chk_date
    FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete
    WHERE completed = TRUE
      AND chk_date <= :date_param
),
latest_runs AS (
    SELECT workspace_id, run_id
    FROM (
        SELECT
            wrc.workspace_id,
            wrc.run_id,
            ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
                PARTITION BY wrc.workspace_id
                ORDER BY wrc.chk_date DESC, wrc.run_id DESC
            ) AS rn
        FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc
        WHERE wrc.completed = TRUE
          AND wrc.chk_date = (SELECT chk_date FROM chosen_date)
    ) t
    WHERE rn = 1
)
SELECT
    concat(aw.workspace_name, ' (', aw.workspace_id, ')') AS workspace,
    COUNT(*) AS total_deviations
FROM `sat`.security_analysis.security_checks sc
JOIN `sat`.security_analysis.security_best_practices sbp
  ON sc.id = sbp.id
JOIN `sat`.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
  ON sc.workspaceid = aw.workspace_id
JOIN latest_runs lr
  ON sc.run_id = lr.run_id
 AND sc.workspaceid = lr.workspace_id
WHERE sbp.category = :category
  AND sc.score = 1
GROUP BY aw.workspace_name, aw.workspace_id
ORDER BY total_deviations DESC;

datasets.name: b713809b
queryLines:
WITH param_ws AS (
  -- Normalize dropdown parameter: extracts numeric ID if format is "Name (12345)"
  SELECT COALESCE(NULLIF(regexp_extract(:workspaceid, '\\((\\d+)\\)', 1), ''), :workspaceid) AS ws_id
),
severities AS (
  SELECT 'High' AS severity, 3 AS ord
  UNION ALL
  SELECT 'Medium', 2
  UNION ALL
  SELECT 'Low', 1
),
chosen_date AS (
  SELECT COALESCE(
           (SELECT MAX(chk_date)
            FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete
            WHERE completed = true
              AND chk_date = :date_param),
           (SELECT MAX(chk_date)
            FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete
            WHERE completed = true
              AND chk_date < :date_param)
         ) AS chk_date
),
latest_run AS (
  SELECT t.workspace_id, t.run_id
  FROM (
    SELECT
      wrc.workspace_id,
      wrc.run_id,
      ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
        PARTITION BY wrc.workspace_id
        ORDER BY wrc.chk_date DESC, wrc.run_id DESC
      ) AS rn
    FROM `sat`.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc
    JOIN param_ws p
      ON wrc.workspace_id = p.ws_id
    WHERE wrc.completed = true
      AND wrc.chk_date = (SELECT chk_date FROM chosen_date)
  ) t
  WHERE t.rn = 1
),
master AS (
  SELECT
    category,
    COUNT(*) AS category_count
  FROM `sat`.security_analysis.security_best_practices
  WHERE category NOT IN ('Workspace Settings', 'Workspace Stats')
  GROUP BY category
),
results AS (
  SELECT
    sbp.category,
    sbp.severity,
    COUNT(*) AS severity_count
  FROM `sat`.security_analysis.security_checks sc
  JOIN `sat`.security_analysis.security_best_practices sbp
    ON sc.id = sbp.id
  JOIN latest_run lr
    ON sc.run_id = lr.run_id
   AND sc.workspaceid = lr.workspace_id
  WHERE sc.score = 1
    AND sbp.category NOT IN ('Workspace Settings', 'Workspace Stats')
  GROUP BY sbp.category, sbp.severity
),
category_totals AS (
  SELECT
    r.category,
    SUM(r.severity_count) AS total_deviations
  FROM results r
  GROUP BY r.category
)
SELECT
  m.category AS category,
  m.category_count AS total_checks,
  s.severity,
  COALESCE(r.severity_count, 0) AS severity_count,
  s.ord,
  COALESCE(ct.total_deviations, 0) AS total_deviations,
  CONCAT(
    (m.category_count - COALESCE(ct.total_deviations, 0)),
    '/', 
    m.category_count,
    ' passed'
  ) AS passed_checks,
  try_divide(
    (m.category_count - COALESCE(ct.total_deviations, 0))::decimal,
    NULLIF(m.category_count, 0)
  ) AS category_pct
FROM master m
CROSS JOIN severities s
LEFT JOIN results r
  ON m.category = r.category AND s.severity = r.severity
LEFT JOIN category_totals ct
  ON m.category = ct.category
ORDER BY m.category, s.ord DESC;

datasets.name: 9f4edcfc
queryLines:
WITH job_info AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT
    job_id,
    name AS job_name
  FROM system.lakeflow.jobs
  WHERE trim(regexp_replace(name, '\s+', ' ')) = 'SAT Driver Notebook'
),
job_runs AS (
  SELECT
    t.run_id,
    t.job_id,
    t.period_start_time,
    t.period_end_time,
    j.job_name
  FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline t
  JOIN job_info j
    ON t.job_id = j.job_id
  WHERE t.result_state = 'SUCCEEDED'
    -- keep only the final timeline row for each run
    AND t.period_end_time = (
      SELECT MAX(t2.period_end_time)
      FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline t2
      WHERE t2.run_id = t.run_id
    )
),
latest_run AS (
  SELECT run_id
  FROM job_runs
  WHERE date(period_start_time) <= :date_param
  ORDER BY period_start_time DESC
  LIMIT 1
)
SELECT
  j.job_name,
  j.job_id,
  date_format(from_utc_timestamp(j.period_start_time, 'America/New_York'), 'yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm a') AS period_start_time_local,
  date_format(from_utc_timestamp(j.period_end_time, 'America/New_York'), 'yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm a') AS period_end_time_local,
  TIMESTAMPDIFF(SECOND, j.period_start_time, j.period_end_time) / 60 AS duration_minutes
FROM job_runs j
JOIN latest_run lr
  ON j.run_id = lr.run_id;

datasets.name: 00e28eff
queryLines:
WITH latest_runs AS (
  SELECT workspace_id, MAX(run_id) AS latest_run_id
  FROM `sat`.security_analysis.secret_scan_results
  GROUP BY workspace_id
),
latest_results AS (
  SELECT s.*
  FROM `sat`.security_analysis.secret_scan_results s
  JOIN latest_runs l
    ON s.workspace_id = l.workspace_id AND s.run_id = l.latest_run_id
),
notebooks_with_secrets AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT workspace_id, notebook_id
  FROM latest_results
  WHERE secrets_found > 0
),
unique_secrets AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT secret_sha256
  FROM latest_results
  WHERE secret_sha256 IS NOT NULL AND secrets_found > 0
),
total_findings AS (
  SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT CONCAT(secret_sha256, '|', detector_name, '|', notebook_id)) AS total_count
  FROM latest_results
  WHERE secrets_found > 0
)
SELECT
  COUNT(DISTINCT nws.workspace_id) AS workspaces_with_secrets,
  COUNT(DISTINCT nws.notebook_id) AS notebooks_with_secrets,
  (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM unique_secrets) AS unique_secrets_detected,
  (SELECT total_count FROM total_findings) AS total_secret_findings,
  date_format(
    from_utc_timestamp(MAX(lr.scan_time), 'America/New_York'),
    'yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm a'
  ) AS latest_scan_time_est
FROM latest_results lr
LEFT JOIN notebooks_with_secrets nws
  ON lr.workspace_id = nws.workspace_id AND lr.notebook_id = nws.notebook_id
GROUP BY 1=1;

datasets.name: e6c44ec0
queryLines:
WITH latest_runs AS (
  -- Get latest run_id per workspace
  SELECT workspace_id, MAX(run_id) AS latest_run_id
  FROM `sat`.security_analysis.secret_scan_results
  GROUP BY workspace_id
),
latest_results AS (
  -- Get all rows from each workspace's latest run
  SELECT s.*
  FROM `sat`.security_analysis.secret_scan_results s
  JOIN latest_runs l
    ON s.workspace_id = l.workspace_id
   AND s.run_id = l.latest_run_id
)
SELECT
  lr.workspace_id,
  MAX(lr.scan_time) AS scan_time,
  date_format(
    from_utc_timestamp(MAX(lr.scan_time), 'America/New_York'),
    'yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm a'
  ) AS scan_time_est
FROM latest_results lr
WHERE lr.secrets_found > 0  
GROUP BY lr.workspace_id
ORDER BY lr.workspace_id;

datasets.name: 6dbb433f
queryLines:
WITH latest_run AS (
  SELECT workspace_id, MAX(run_id) AS latest_run_id
  FROM `sat`.security_analysis.secret_scan_results
  WHERE workspace_id = :workspace_id
  GROUP BY workspace_id
),
latest_results AS (
  SELECT s.*
  FROM `sat`.security_analysis.secret_scan_results s
  JOIN latest_run l
    ON s.workspace_id = l.workspace_id
   AND s.run_id = l.latest_run_id
   AND s.secrets_found > 0
),
deduped AS (
  SELECT
    url_decode(notebook_path) AS notebook_path,
    notebook_name,
    CASE 
      WHEN detector_name = 'CustomRegex' THEN 'Custom Secrets'
      ELSE detector_name 
    END AS detection_type,
    secret_sha256 AS secret_hash,
    -- Prefer verified = true when duplicates exist
    MAX(CASE WHEN verified THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS verified_flag,
    MAX(scan_time) AS scan_time
  FROM latest_results
  GROUP BY notebook_path, notebook_name, detection_type, secret_hash
)
SELECT
  notebook_path,
  notebook_name,
  detection_type,
  secret_hash,
  verified_flag = 1 AS verified,
  date_format(
    from_utc_timestamp(scan_time, 'America/New_York'),
    'yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm a'
  ) AS scan_time_est
FROM deduped
ORDER BY notebook_path, detection_type;

datasets.name: 236f2a8a
queryLines:
WITH latest_run AS (
  -- Get the latest run_id for the selected workspace
  SELECT workspace_id, MAX(run_id) AS latest_run_id
  FROM `sat`.security_analysis.secret_scan_results
  WHERE workspace_id = :workspace_id
  GROUP BY workspace_id
),
latest_results AS (
  -- Get all rows from that latest run for the workspace
  SELECT s.*
  FROM `sat`.security_analysis.secret_scan_results s
  JOIN latest_run l
    ON s.workspace_id = l.workspace_id
   AND s.run_id = l.latest_run_id
),
notebooks_with_secrets AS (
  -- Deduplicate notebooks that have at least one secret
  SELECT DISTINCT workspace_id, notebook_id
  FROM latest_results
  WHERE secrets_found > 0
),
unique_secrets AS (
  -- Deduplicate unique secrets across the latest results
  SELECT DISTINCT secret_sha256
  FROM latest_results
  WHERE secret_sha256 IS NOT NULL AND secrets_found > 0
),
total_findings AS (
  -- Count unique combinations of secret + detector + notebook
  SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT CONCAT(secret_sha256, '|', detector_name, '|', notebook_id)) AS total_count
  FROM latest_results
  WHERE secrets_found > 0
)
SELECT
  COALESCE(COUNT(DISTINCT nws.workspace_id), 0) AS workspaces_with_secrets,
  COALESCE(COUNT(DISTINCT nws.notebook_id), 0) AS notebooks_with_secrets,
  COALESCE((SELECT COUNT(*) FROM unique_secrets), 0) AS unique_secrets_detected,
  COALESCE((SELECT total_count FROM total_findings), 0) AS total_secret_findings,
  date_format(
    from_utc_timestamp(MAX(lr.scan_time), 'America/New_York'),
    'yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm a'
  ) AS latest_scan_time_est
FROM latest_results lr
LEFT JOIN notebooks_with_secrets nws
  ON lr.workspace_id = nws.workspace_id
 AND lr.notebook_id = nws.notebook_id
GROUP BY 1=1;

datasets.name: 94728c57
queryLines:
WITH completed_runs AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT
    wrc.workspace_id,
    wrc.run_id,
    wrc.chk_date,
    wrc.completed
  FROM sat.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc
  INNER JOIN sat.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
    ON wrc.workspace_id = aw.workspace_id
  WHERE concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid
    AND wrc.completed = true
),
check_scores AS (
  SELECT
    sc.run_id,
    cr.chk_date,
    bp.severity,
    COUNT(CASE WHEN sc.score = 0 THEN 1 END) AS passed_checks,
    COUNT(CASE WHEN sc.score = 1 THEN 1 END) AS failed_checks,
    COUNT(*) AS total_checks
  FROM sat.security_analysis.security_checks sc
  INNER JOIN completed_runs cr ON sc.run_id = cr.run_id AND sc.workspaceid = cr.workspace_id
  INNER JOIN sat.security_analysis.security_best_practices bp ON sc.id = bp.id
  GROUP BY sc.workspaceid, sc.run_id, cr.chk_date, bp.severity
)
SELECT
  chk_date AS scan_date,
  severity,
  SUM(passed_checks) AS passed,
  SUM(failed_checks) AS failed,
  SUM(total_checks) AS total
FROM check_scores
GROUP BY chk_date, severity
ORDER BY chk_date, severity;

datasets.name: a433fdc0
queryLines:
WITH completed_runs AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT
    wrc.workspace_id,
    wrc.run_id,
    wrc.chk_date,
    wrc.completed
  FROM sat.security_analysis.workspace_run_complete wrc
  INNER JOIN sat.security_analysis.account_workspaces aw
    ON wrc.workspace_id = aw.workspace_id
  WHERE concat(aw.workspace_name, " (", aw.workspace_id, ")") = :workspaceid
    AND wrc.completed = true
),
check_scores AS (
  SELECT
    sc.run_id,
    cr.chk_date,
    bp.severity,
    COUNT(CASE WHEN sc.score = 0 THEN 1 END) AS passed_checks,
    COUNT(CASE WHEN sc.score = 1 THEN 1 END) AS failed_checks,
    COUNT(*) AS total_checks
  FROM sat.security_analysis.security_checks sc
  INNER JOIN completed_runs cr ON sc.run_id = cr.run_id
  INNER JOIN sat.security_analysis.security_best_practices bp ON sc.id = bp.id
  GROUP BY sc.run_id, cr.chk_date, bp.severity
)
SELECT
  chk_date AS scan_date,
  severity,
  SUM(passed_checks) AS passed,
  SUM(failed_checks) AS failed,
  SUM(total_checks) AS total
FROM check_scores
GROUP BY chk_date, severity
ORDER BY chk_date, severity;

frame.title: Workspace Deviations
frame.description:
Identifies the number of deviations per workspace (scanned by the SAT Driver), grouped by severity.
For additional details on specific workspaces, copy the workspace name and apply it as a filter on the ‘Workspace Drill-Down’ page.

lines: ![Risk Fraud Detection](https://cdn.bfldr.com/9AYANS2F/at/3sck7qkbw5n2tmc94g5gkjw/primary-icon-orange-risk-fraud-detection.svg?auto=webp&format=svg&width=1000&height=1000)

Review the SAT report with your business stakeholders, administrators, security team and auditors. Assess your organizational security requirements *carefully* before making changes based on the report - not all deviations require mitigation. Some recommendations may have cost implications, and some of the security recommendations may have dependency limitations. Always thoroughly review the associated feature documentation before modifying your security configurations.

frame.title: Latest Job Run Details
frame.description:
If no SAT Driver or Secrets Scanner job ran on the selected date, the latest successful run before that date will be shown.
(Note: System Tables latency can delay recent job data.)

frame.title: Severity Breakdown Across Categories
frame.description: Total deviations across all workspaces, broken down by category and severity.

frame.title: Severity Distributions Across All Categories
frame.description: Proportion of deviations for each severity across all workspaces and categories.

lines: ![Threat](https://cdn.bfldr.com/9AYANS2F/at/sscnvjbhxxjw8btnf99crx5/primary-icon-orange-endpoint.svg?auto=webp&format=png)

### Network Security
---
Ensures secure, controlled connectivity for all Databricks resources through network isolation and access restrictions. Checks may include secure cluster connectivity, customer-managed VPCs or VNet injection, VPC peering, and IP access lists, with additional controls as needed.

### Identity & Access
---
Ensures that only authorized users and services can access Databricks resources. Checks may include single sign-on, SCIM-based user provisioning, role-based access control, and token management, with additional identity and access safeguards as needed.

### Data Protection
---
Ensures sensitive information is protected from unauthorized access, disclosure, or loss. Checks may include secrets management, encryption, and data exfiltration protections, along with other data security measures as needed.

### Governance
---
Ensures compliance, accountability, and standardized configurations across the Databricks environment. Checks may include cluster policies, audit logs (diagnostic logs on Azure), init scripts, and DBFS mounts, along with other governance controls as needed.

### Informational
---
Ensures visibility into workspace configuration and usage to support monitoring and decision-making. Checks may include admin counts, ACLs, user privileges, and library or repo usage, along with other informational insights as needed.
# Executive Summary

# Network Security Ensures secure, controlled connectivity for all Databricks resources through network isolation and access restrictions. Checks may include secure cluster connectivity, customer-managed VPCs or VNet injection, VPC peering, and IP access lists, with additional controls as needed.

# Identity & Access Ensures that only authorized users and services can access Databricks resources. Checks may include single sign-on, SCIM-based user provisioning, role-based access control, and token management, with additional identity and access safeguards as needed.

# Governance Ensures compliance, accountability, and standardized configurations across the Databricks environment. Checks may include cluster policies, audit logs (diagnostic logs on Azure), init scripts, and DBFS mounts, along with other governance controls as needed.

# Data Protection Ensures sensitive information is protected from unauthorized access, disclosure, or loss. Checks may include secrets management, encryption, and data exfiltration protections, along with other data security measures as needed.
![alt text](https://cdn.bfldr.com/9AYANS2F/at/5n7h4nfbnb6w5wfs24p52qrw/primary-icon-orange-cloud-security.svg?auto=webp&format=svg)

# Informational Ensures visibility into workspace configuration and usage to support monitoring and decision-making. Checks may include admin counts, ACLs, user privileges, and library or repo usage, along with other informational insights as needed.
![Risk Fraud Detection](https://cdn.bfldr.com/9AYANS2F/at/3sck7qkbw5n2tmc94g5gkjw/primary-icon-orange-risk-fraud-detection.svg?auto=webp&format=svg&width=1000&height=1000)

**Note:** Complete the self-assessment for **SSO, SCIM, and Table Access Control** as described in the [Usage Instructions](https://databricks-industry-solutions.github.io/security-analysis-tool/docs/usage/). Update the file at:

`Workspace → Applications → SAT → files → configs → self_assessment_checks.yaml`

Set the `"enabled"` values to `true` or `false` based on your environment. The **Security Analysis Tool (SAT)** will automatically validate all other configurations.

lines: # Secrets Scanner Detects exposed credentials such as API keys, tokens, and passwords across Databricks Notebooks. Helps quickly identify, prioritize, and remediate secret leaks to keep Databricks workspaces secure.

![Risk Fraud Detection](https://cdn.bfldr.com/9AYANS2F/at/btb4hjtf9mg35wxhpj59cv7g/primary-icon-orange-attacker.svg?auto=webp&format=svg
)

Workspace
frame.description: Select a workspace by its ID to view detailed secret scan results. (Note: Only workspaces with detected secrets will appear in the drop-down list.)

columns.title: Secret Type
columns.description: Note: "Custom Secrets" are organization-defined detection patterns that primarily identify Databricks-specific tokens and credentials.

Total Number of Secrets Detected Across Scanned All Workspaces

lines: ![Threat](https://cdn.bfldr.com/9AYANS2F/at/f5r5mv8nhk62qq52bcktmpr/primary-icon-orange-ransomware.svg?auto=webp&format=svg&width=1000&height=1000)

> **Note:** To protect sensitive information, store credentials **securely** in [Databricks Secret Scopes](https://docs.databricks.com/aws/en/security/secrets#secrets-user-guide&gsc.tab=0). This approach centralizes credential management, enables controlled access across notebooks and jobs, and ensures that sharing credentials is **safe** in your Databricks environment(s).
